text: Custom object rich text properties do not have the ability for content blocks like heading paragraph, blockquote tags etc. *Is there a way to ungate this?*
True true this would be nice
dang I guess that’s a no :cry:
Well while we’re at it an image/media property that pulls from filemanager would be nice too :rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:
What about just the html code block property like the normal editor. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

Is there a way to filter a collection of custom objects based on a property value of an associated custom object in GraphQL? For instance, filtering the collection of contacts based on a category custom property of an associated company? In the GraphQL playground, the only filter options I am presented with look like they are created from the list of properties within the collection I am filtering by, but wanted to check to see if I can filter by criteria beyond those filter options.
